mdRecord.dcterms:title: Verdun
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: United States. Army. Corps of Engineers. Regiment, 29th. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 1 map ; 53 x 83 cm. on sheet 59 x 85 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Reprint of the Verdun sector (Sheet 35) of a topographic map of France. Original publication details printed in lower margin: Levée par les Officiers du Corps d'Etat-Major, et publiée par le Dépôt de la Guerre en 1835. Revisée en 1911. Gravée le trait par Thierry, la lettre par Hacq, le figure du terrain par Blacher. [original]
Sheet number"35" printed in upper right margin. Includes index to adjoining sheets and compilation diagram. [original]
Relief shown with hachures and spot heights. [original]
Verdun is near the southeast corner of the map, which extends west to Suippes then north to Ste. Vauborg in the west and Jametz in the east. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: World War, 1914-1918--France--Maps, Topographic
Meuse (France)--Maps, Topographic
Verdun (France)--Maps, Topographic
